titles.title: A bill to terminate employment of aliens in U.S. missions and consular posts in certain communist countries.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Committee on Foreign Relations requested executive comment from State Department.

bill.summary: 4/29/1987--Introduced. Prohibits the percentage of aliens employed by any U.S. diplomatic mission and consular post in a Warsaw Pact country from exceeding the percentage of American nationals employed by the diplomatic mission and consular posts of such country in the United States. Permits exceptions to such prohibition if the Secretary of State determines and certifies that the admission of additional foreign nationals in any U.S. diplomatic or consular post is essential to its operation.
